snippet: Two and a half years after the earthquake, the pressing need for safe, stable housing for all displaced people in Haiti remains unmet, despite billions of dollars in reconstruction aid.
abstract: Most pressing need in Haiti--safe, stable housing for everyone displaced by the 2012 earthquake--remains unmet despite billions of dollars in reconstruction aid; in what international officials term a protracted humanitarian crisis, hundreds of thousands remain in increasingly wretched tent camps, tens of thousands inhabit dangerously damaged buildings and countless others have simply disappeared with raggedy tarps and rusty sheet metal into the hills.
lead_paragraph: Two and a half years after the earthquake, the pressing need for safe, stable housing for all displaced people in Haiti remains unmet, despite billions of dollars in reconstruction aid.

headline.seo: Years After Haiti Quake, Safe Housing Is Dream for Multitudes
headline.main: Years After Haiti Quake, Safe Housing Is a Dream for Many
headline.print_headline: Years After Haiti Quake, Safe Housing Is Dream for Multitudes
